title: Order 2020 (S.I. No. 351 of 2020)) for the purpose of giving full effect to
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Road Safety Authority
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Road Safety Authority 
(Commercial Vehicle Roadworthiness) (Vehicle Testing) (Amendment) 
Regulations 2023.
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited road safety authority (commercial vehicle roadworthiness) (vehicle testing) (amendment) regulation 2023

title: Order 2020 (S.I. No. 351 of 2020)) for the purpose of giving full effect to
heading: 2. The Commercial Vehicle Roadworthiness (Vehicle Testing) (No. 2)
text_raw:
2. The Commercial Vehicle Roadworthiness (Vehicle Testing) (No. 2) 

Regulations 2013 (S.I. No. 347 of 2013) are amended - 

(a) 

in Regulation 3, by inserting the following definitions: 

“‘Commission Implementing Regulation’ means Commission 
Implementing Regulation (EU) 2021/392 of 4 March 20211; 

‘real-world data’ shall be construed in accordance with Article 2 
(c) of the Commission Implementing Regulation;”, and 

(b) by inserting after Regulation 21 the following: 

“Collecting of real-world data and VINS 

21A When carrying out a CVR test on a CVR vehicle to 
which Article 10 of the Commission Implementing Regulation 
applies, a CVR tester shall collect real-world data and VINS in 
accordance with that Article.”. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

16 May, 2023. 

EAMON RYAN, 

Minister for Transport. 

1 OJ No. L77, 5.3.2021, p. 8 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 19th May, 2023. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [241] 3

title: Order 2020 (S.I. No. 351 of 2020)) for the purpose of giving full effect to
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations give full effect to Article 10 of Commission Implementing 
Regulation (EU) 2021/392 for the collection of real-world data from new light 
commercial vehicles that are first registered from 1 January 2021 and that are 
equipped with on-board fuel and/or energy consumption monitoring devices at 
the Commercial Vehicle Roadworthiness Test. 

 
 
 
 
 
 4 [241]
